benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/invoices - Retrieve account invoices

covered: Valid Request: Successful retrieval scenarios (TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC06, TC07) validate expected 200 responses and JSON invoice arrays.
Empty Response: TC08 and TC25 verify behavior when no invoices match (empty JSON array).

Query Parameters: Wide coverage of query parameters (startDate, endDate, withMigrationInvoices, unpaidInvoicesOnly, includeVoidedInvoices, audit) including combinations (TC07, TC24) and edge cases (TC21, TC22, TC23).
Authorization: Authentication-related error handling is covered (TC12 missing token -> 401, TC13 invalid token -> 401).
Input Validation & Security: Malformed accountId (TC10), extremely large accountId (TC26), SQL injection-like input (TC15), and XSS attempts (TC27) are addressed.
Error Scenarios: 400 for invalid input (TC10, TC15, TC21), 404 for non-existent account (TC11), 503 service unavailable (TC14) are present.
Performance/Scale & Robustness: Large-volume scenario (TC16) and slow downstream dependency (TC17) and concurrent requests (TC18) are included to exercise performance and resilience.
Regression & Backward Compatibility: Regression checks for unpaidInvoicesOnly (TC19) and no-params backward compatibility (TC20) present.
Integration & Data Consistency: Downstream inconsistent data handling is included (TC28).
Documentation/Accessibility: API docs accessibility and parameter coverage is present (TC29).
gaps: Pagination: Although TC16 mentions large volume and “may be paginated”, there are no explicit tests for pagination controls (page/limit/offset or cursor), boundary/page navigation, and correctness of paging metadata.
Caching Behavior: No tests verify caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified) or conditional GET behavior (If-None-Match / 304 responses).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests for rate limiting responses (e.g., 429) or behavior under throttling.
Authorization: 403 Forbidden cases (e.g., valid token but insufficient permissions / RBAC) are not covered.
Response Schema & Content Validation: There are no explicit tests asserting full invoice object schema, required fields, data types, content-type header, or response size limits.
Pagination performance and consistency under concurrent paged requests: concurrency (TC18) exists but not exercised together with pagination to ensure stable paged responses under load.
Cache / Consistency interactions: No tests for interactions between caching and filters (e.g., differing query params producing cached stale responses).
Localization / Timezone handling: Date filters lack tests for timezone edge cases (timestamps vs date-only inputs).
Rate-limited retry/backoff behavior: No tests for client/backoff or server Retry-After header handling.
recommendations: Add explicit pagination tests: request page/limit combinations, verify paging metadata (total, offset/next links or cursors), boundary conditions (last page, page beyond range) and correctness of items per page.

Add caching tests: verify presence and correctness of Cache-Control, ETag, Last-Modified headers; test conditional GETs returning 304 when appropriate and ensure filtered responses do not incorrectly return cached data.
Add rate-limiting tests: simulate bursts of requests to validate 429 responses, Retry-After header, and graceful client behavior.
Add authorization/permission tests for 403 cases: validate behavior when a token is valid but lacks permission to view account invoices.
Add response schema validation tests: assert invoice JSON fields, types, required properties, and Content-Type application/json for all success responses.
Combine pagination with concurrency and large-volume scenarios to validate consistent, stable paged responses under load.
Add timezone tests for date filters: provide date/timestamp inputs in different timezones and assert consistent filtering semantics.
Add tests for Retry-After/backoff and client retry behavior in presence of transient errors (5xx/504/429).
Add tests to ensure query parameter handling does not produce stale cached responses when different filters are used (cache key correctness).
